  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
I hope you had a great Fourth of July.
 
The holiday caused some travel snarls around the
  country this week. But when traveling by air, how long could you wait for
  your flight? Hours? Days? Even if a flight is only slightly delayed, that can
  mean many extra hours in airports – and sometimes ruined plans – for
  travelers. Nancy Cordes will have more tonight.
 
Of course some air travel waits can be attributed to
  extreme weather. In pockets of the United States this week, there’s
  flooding, drought, storms and fire. Sandra Hughes and Hari Sreenivasan will
  have reports on the havoc weather is unleashing on Americans.
 
Military recruitment numbers have been unpredictable
  during the U.S.
  involvement in Iraq.
  But now National Guard recruitment numbers are up. Our national security correspondent
  David Martin will tell you how the guard turned their numbers around.
 
And I’ll have a story about two leukemia
  patients’ quests to find bone marrow donors. You’ll be surprised
  how painless it can be these days to become a donor – and even to save
  a life.
 
We’ll end tonight’s broadcast with a report
  from Kimberly Dozier about some hand-crafted gifts that have touched the
  hearts of many. They come from ordinary Americans – and go to wounded
  war veterans. And they provide a comfort Dozier experienced firsthand.
 
Thanks. I hope you’ll join us,
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
